headline: Companies Warn Investors: Immigration Policy Poses Threat to Business
summary: President Trump’s deportation push is prompting more companies to warn investors that immigration policy could hurt their business.  Nearly 90 consumer companies cited immigration in the first three months of the year when telling investors about significant risks facing their companies, up from about 70 a year earlier and nearly double the levels before Trump's first election, according to data provider AlphaSense.  Coca-Cola, Colgate-Palmolive, Modelo brewer Constellation Brands and other companies over the past few months have told investors that a decline in Hispanic spending is hurting their sales.

headline: Colgate Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend
summary: NEW YORK, June 12, 2025--The Board of Directors of Colgate-Palmolive Company (NYSE:CL) today declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.52 per common share, payable on August 15, 2025, to shareholders of record on July 18, 2025. The Company has paid uninterrupted dividends on its common stock since 1895.

headline: Is PG's Supply Chain Revamp a Game-Changer in Consumer Staples?
summary: Procter & Gamble's digital supply chain overhaul and AI-powered automation aim to blunt tariff shocks and boost resilience.
